member.param: The block to assign to the grid position
The column index in the grid
The row index in the grid
member.returns: True if the block was successfully assigned, false if the position is invalid or already contains a solid block

member.name: M:Map.CheckPersistBlocksPastLevelLoad
member.summary: Checks whether blocks should be persisted after a level load and either maintains or destroys them accordingly. This method is called after level transitions to handle the persistence state.
member.remarks: Only processes persistence if loading time optimizations are active. Sets hasPersistedPastLevelLoad to true if persistence is enabled, otherwise calls DestroyPersistantBlocks to clear any persisted blocks.

member.name: M:Map.CheckPersistBlocksPastLevelLoad
member.summary: Checks and applies block persistence settings after a level load.
member.remarks: Called after level loading to determine if persistent blocks should be maintained or destroyed. Only applies when loading time reduction is active. Sets the hasPersistedPastLevelLoad flag if persistence is enabled.

member.name: M:Map.ClearBackgroundBlock(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Destroys and removes the background block at the specified grid coordinates if it exists.
member.param: The column index in the grid
The row index in the grid

member.name: M:Map.ClearForegroundBlock(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Destroys and removes the foreground block at the specified grid coordinates. Also handles clearing the upper part of 2-unit tall blocks.
member.param: The column index in the grid
The row index in the grid

member.name: M:Map.ClearPersistenBlocksInstant
member.summary: Immediately clears all persisted blocks without waiting for a level transition. This provides a way to force-clear persistence state during gameplay.
member.remarks: Resets the hasPersistedPastLevelLoad flag and calls DestroyPersistantBlocks to remove all persisted blocks immediately.

member.name: M:Map.ClearPersistenBlocksInstant
member.summary: Immediately clears all persistent blocks without waiting for level transition.
member.remarks: Resets the persistence flag and destroys all persistent blocks instantly. Used when an immediate cleanup is required rather than waiting for the normal level transition process. Note the typo in the method name.

member.name: M:Map.CollapseTop
member.summary: Collapses the top row of the map by destroying blocks and lowering the ceiling.
member.returns: The new highest solid block row index after collapse
member.remarks: This method implements a ceiling collapse mechanic by decrementing highestSolidBlock (minimum 11) and destroying blocks in the rows above it. For each column, it checks a sphere area around blocks in the collapse zone. Most block types are instantly destroyed with InstaGib damage, but certain types like barrels, rockets, ladders, and cages are preserved. Non-block objects in the area receive 15 damage. This creates a crushing ceiling effect often used in escape sequences.

member.name: M:Map.CollapseTopLadders
member.summary: Specifically collapses ladder blocks from the top of the map.
member.returns: The highest solid block value (not the ladder-specific value)
member.remarks: This method decrements highestSolidBlockLadder (minimum 16) and destroys only ladder blocks in the affected rows. Unlike CollapseTop(), this targets ladders specifically, useful for preventing vertical escape routes during collapse sequences. The method checks block types directly from the blocks array and sends InstaGib damage to ladder blocks. Note that it returns highestSolidBlock, not highestSolidBlockLadder.

member.name: M:Map.CreateExitPortal(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Creates a hero level exit portal at the specified position. The portal is positioned with a vertical offset of 112 units and a horizontal offset of 16 units from the provided coordinates.
member.param: The base position where the portal should be created
member.remarks: The portal is instantiated from the exitPortalPrefabReference asset and registered with the game's networking system using a deterministic network ID. This ensures the portal is properly synchronized across all clients in multiplayer sessions.

member.name: M:Map.DeactivateHalfTheMap
member.summary: Deactivates the right half of the map by disabling all blocks beyond the midpoint.
member.remarks: This method provides a simple way to hide half the map, typically used for debugging or special game modes. It deactivates all blocks from the horizontal midpoint to the right edge of the map. Only the block GameObjects are deactivated; the block data remains intact. This is separate from the dynamic offscreen deactivation system and provides a static way to reduce the active map size.

member.name: M:Map.DestroyPersistantBlocks
member.summary: Destroys all persisted blocks and clears the persistence system. This removes both foreground and background persistent blocks and their container GameObject.
member.remarks: Iterates through all persistent block arrays and destroys each block's GameObject before clearing the arrays and destroying the persistent container. Also resets the hasPersistedPastLevelLoad flag.

member.name: M:Map.DestroyPersistantBlocks
member.summary: Destroys all persistent blocks and cleans up persistence-related data structures.
member.remarks: Iterates through all persistent block arrays and destroys the game objects, then nullifies the arrays and destroys the persistent container object. This ensures a complete cleanup of the persistence system. Note the typo in the method name (Persistant vs Persistent) is from the original code.

member.name: M:Map.DontPersistBlocks
member.summary: Disables block persistence for the next level load. This prevents blocks from being maintained between level transitions, ensuring a fresh map state.
member.remarks: Sets the persistPastLevelLoad flag to false. This method should be called when you want to ensure all blocks are cleared and recreated on the next level load, typically when transitioning to a completely different area.

member.name: M:Map.DontPersistBlocks
member.summary: Disables block persistence for the current level transition.
member.remarks: Prevents blocks from being carried over to the next level load. This is typically used when transitioning between completely different level sections or when a clean slate is required.

member.name: M:Map.ExtendDisableToUnitPosition(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Extends the active area bounds to include the specified unit position with a buffer.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the unit
The y-coordinate of the unit
The buffer distance around the unit (default: 48 units)
member.remarks: This method ensures important units remain in the active area even if they're outside the normal camera bounds. It updates the min/max unit position trackers which are consumed by RunDeactivationOffscreen() to extend the active area. This prevents important gameplay elements like bosses or objective units from being deactivated when slightly offscreen. The buffer parameter adds extra space around the unit to ensure smooth activation transitions.

member.name: M:Map.GetBackgroundBlock(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the background block at the specified grid coordinates.
member.param: The column index in the grid
The row index in the grid
member.returns: The background block at the specified position, or null if the position is out of bounds or empty

member.name: M:Map.GetBackgroundGroundType(System.Int32,System.Int32,GroundType)
member.summary: Retrieves the ground type of the background block at the specified grid coordinates, falling back to the foreground block if no background block exists.
member.param: The column index in the grid

member.name: M:Map.InitializeDeactivationOffscreen
member.summary: Initializes the offscreen deactivation system to its default state covering the entire map.
member.remarks: This method sets up the offscreen culling system by initializing the active area to encompass the full map bounds (0 to width-1, 0 to height-1). It also resets the unit position tracking variables to zero and sets the runDeactivationOffscreenIsSetup flag. This system is used to optimize performance by deactivating blocks and objects that are far from the camera view. Must be called before RunDeactivationOffscreen() can function properly.

It's useful for determining if attacks or effects can reach the sky, or if there's protective terrain overhead. The check uses IsBlockInvulnerable() for each grid position.

member.name: M:Map.MakeBlockPersist(Block)
member.summary: Marks a specific block for persistence by transferring it to the persistent blocks container. This is a helper method used by PersistBlocks to process individual blocks.
member.param: The block to make persistent
member.remarks: Simply calls the Persist method to reparent the block's GameObject to the persistent container.

member.name: M:Map.MakeBlockPersist(Block)
member.summary: Marks a single block to persist across level transitions.
member.param: The block to make persistent.
member.remarks: Simple wrapper that calls the Persist method with the block's game object. Part of the internal persistence system workflow.

member.name: M:Map.Persist(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Transfers a GameObject to the persistent blocks container by changing its parent. This ensures the object survives scene transitions when persistence is enabled.
member.param: The GameObject to make persistent
member.remarks: Reparents the GameObject to the PersistentBlocks.Instance transform, which is marked as DontDestroyOnLoad to survive scene changes.

member.name: M:Map.Persist(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Moves a game object to the persistent blocks container to survive level transitions.
member.param: The game object to make persistent.
member.remarks: Reparents the object to the PersistentBlocks singleton instance, which is configured to not be destroyed on level load. This is the core mechanism for block persistence.

member.name: M:Map.PersistBlocks
member.summary: Enables block persistence and transfers all current foreground and background blocks to the persistent storage system. This allows blocks to survive level transitions when loading time optimizations are active.
member.remarks: Creates a persistent GameObject container if needed and iterates through all map blocks, marking matching persistent blocks for retention. Respects the dontPersistedPastLevelLoadThisLevel flag to handle special cases where persistence should be skipped.

member.name: M:Map.PersistBlocks
member.summary: Enables block persistence and prepares blocks to survive the next level transition.
member.remarks: Creates a persistent game object container if needed and marks matching blocks in both foreground and background layers for persistence. Blocks are only persisted if they exist in both the current map and the persistent block arrays. Respects the dontPersistedPastLevelLoadThisLevel flag to allow temporary overrides.

member.name: M:Map.RotateBlock(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Rotates the foreground block at the specified grid coordinates if it exists.
member.param: The column index in the grid
The row index in the grid
The rotation direction to apply to the block

member.name: M:Map.RunDeactivationOffscreen
member.summary: Updates the active area of the map based on camera position and unit locations, deactivating distant blocks.
member.remarks: This comprehensive optimization method manages which blocks are active based on proximity to the camera and important units. It calculates an active area using screen bounds plus a 256x160 unit buffer, then extends this area to include any tracked unit positions. The method efficiently updates block activation states only for blocks entering or leaving the active area, rather than processing all blocks every frame. The method tracks the previously active area and only processes blocks in the difference between old and new bounds, significantly reducing processing overhead. Both foreground and background blocks are managed. This system is crucial for maintaining performance in large maps by keeping only nearby blocks active.

member.name: M:Map.SetBackgroundBlockEmpty(Block,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a specific block from the background grid if it matches the provided block reference.
member.param: The block instance to remove (must match the block at the position)
The column index in the grid
The row index in the grid
member.returns: True if the block matched and was removed, false if a different block exists at that position

member.name: M:Map.SetBlockEmpty(Block,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a specific block from the foreground grid if it matches the provided block reference or if the position is already empty.
member.param: The block instance to remove (must match the block at the position)
The column index in the grid
The row index in the grid
member.returns: True if the block was removed or position was already empty, false if a different block exists at that position

member.name: M:Map.SetStartFromHorizontalSuperCheckPoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets up a horizontal super checkpoint with a specific X-axis load offset. This is used for horizontal level transitions where the map needs to load at a specific horizontal position.
member.param: The horizontal offset for loading the level, clamped to non-negative values
member.remarks: If the offset differs from the last load offset, persistence is disabled for this level to ensure a clean transition. The offset determines where in the level the player spawns horizontally.

member.name: M:Map.SetStartFromSuperCheckPoint
member.summary: Marks that the next level load should start from a super checkpoint. This affects spawn positioning and level initialization.
member.remarks: Sets the startFromSuperCheckPoint flag to true. Super checkpoints are special checkpoint types that typically mark major progression points or area transitions.

member.name: M:Map.SetStartFromVerticalSuperCheckPoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets up a vertical super checkpoint with a specific Y-axis load offset. This is used for vertical level transitions where the map needs to load at a specific vertical position.
member.param: The vertical offset for loading the level, clamped to non-negative values
member.remarks: If the offset differs from the last load offset, persistence is disabled for this level to ensure a clean transition. The offset determines where in the level the player spawns vertically.

member.name: M:Map.SetTryReduceLoadingTimes(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables the loading time optimization system. When enabled, the map will attempt to persist certain blocks between level loads to reduce loading times.
member.param: True to enable loading time optimizations, false to disable them
member.remarks: This optimization system works in conjunction with the block persistence methods (PersistBlocks, DontPersistBlocks) to maintain certain map elements across level transitions.

member.name: M:Map.SetTryReduceLoadingTimes(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables the loading time reduction optimization system.
member.param: True to enable optimization; false to disable.
member.remarks: This optimization system affects block persistence and asset pooling to reduce level loading times. The setting is checked in conjunction with level editor status and debug configuration.

member.name: M:Map.TryingToReduceLoadingTimes
member.summary: Checks whether the loading time optimization system is currently active. Returns true only if optimizations are enabled, the level editor is not active, and the asset pool is not disabled.
member.returns: True if loading time optimizations are active and available, false otherwise
member.remarks: This method verifies multiple conditions to ensure optimizations are appropriate for the current game state. It's used by various persistence-related methods to determine whether to maintain blocks between level loads.

member.name: M:Map.TryingToReduceLoadingTimes
member.summary: Checks if the loading time reduction optimization is currently active.
member.returns: True if optimization is enabled and conditions are met; false otherwise.
member.remarks: Returns true only if optimization is enabled, level editor is not active, and asset pooling is not disabled in debug config. This ensures optimizations don't interfere with editing or debugging workflows.

member.name: P:Map.HasBeenSetup

member.name: P:Map.HasSpawnedFlexPower

member.name: P:Map.MapData

member.name: F:Map.HalfTileSize

member.name: F:Map.LevelFileName

member.name: F:Map._hasSpawnedFlexPower

member.name: F:Map._mapData

member.name: F:Map.americaThemeReference
member.summary: Reference to the America/patriotic theme assets holder. Selected as activeTheme when MapData.theme is LevelTheme.America. Features American-themed decorations and environments.

member.name: F:Map.barrelBlockCount
member.summary: A randomized counter used to determine barrel variant spawning. Initialized to a random value between 0 and 100 during map setup. Used in calculations to determine whether to spawn propane tanks, oil barrels, or acid barrels based on the map's configured spawn probabilities.

member.name: F:Map.burningJungleThemeReference
member.summary: Reference to the burning jungle theme assets holder. Selected as activeTheme when MapData.theme is LevelTheme.BurningJungle. Features fire effects, burned vegetation, and destruction-themed assets.

member.name: F:Map.cagesSinceLastHardcoreCage
member.summary: Counts the number of potential cage spawn locations passed since the last hardcore cage was placed. Defaults to 3. When this exceeds 5, forces a cage placement regardless of random chance.

member.name: F:Map.cityThemeReference
member.summary: Reference to the city theme assets holder. Selected as activeTheme when MapData.theme is LevelTheme.City. Contains urban environment prefabs including buildings, streets, and city-specific enemies.

member.name: F:Map.currentBackgroundBlock
member.summary: Temporary reference to the current background block being instantiated during map generation. Used for blocks that have both foreground and background components.

member.name: F:Map.currentBlock

member.name: F:Map.deathMatchHelicopterCount

member.name: F:Map.desertThemeReference

member.name: F:Map.dontPersistedPastLevelLoadThisLevel

member.name: F:Map.followCameraTransform

member.name: F:Map.forceMode
member.summary: Forces a specific game mode when running in the Unity editor. When set to a value other than GameMode.NotSet, overrides the normal game mode selection process. Supports modes like ExplosionRun, DeathMatch, Race, and SuicideHorde for testing.

member.name: F:Map.forceTestLevel

member.name: F:Map.forceThisToBeTheDefaultCampaignScene

member.name: F:Map.forceTryingToReduceLoadingTimes

member.name: F:Map.forestThemeReference

member.name: F:Map.hasPersistedPastLevelLoad

member.name: F:Map.sharedObjectsReference

member.name: F:Map.testLevelFileName

member.name: F:Map.tryingToReduceLoadingTimes

member.name: F:Map.woodBlockCount
