member.name: M:Player.AddPerksToHUD
member.summary: Adds the player's current perks to their HUD display. Retrieves perks from PlayerInventory and displays them on the HUD interface for the player to see their active bonuses.

member.name: M:Player.Awake
member.summary: Initializes the player instance with network instantiation data. Sets up player number, network PID, controller ID, and creates the HUD if needed. Also initializes lives to 0 if the player dropped out this round (except for solo host who gets 1 life).

member.name: M:Player.DisableBotBrain
member.summary: Disables AI control for this player by setting the UsingBotBrain flag to false. The player will return to normal input control after this is called. Note that this doesn't remove the BotBrain component, only disables its use.

member.name: M:Player.EnableBotBrain
member.summary: Enables AI control for this player by adding and configuring a BotBrain component. Creates a new BotBrain component if one doesn't exist, assigns the current character to it, and sets the UsingBotBrain flag to true. This allows the player to be controlled by AI instead of player input.

member.name: M:Player.OnDestroy
member.summary: Cleanup method called when the player object is destroyed. Properly disposes of the player's HUD by unparenting it and destroying the game object, then destroys any active character unit. This ensures proper cleanup of player-owned resources.

member.name: M:Player.ResetPerkValuesOnLevelStart
member.summary: Resets per-level perk values at the start of each level. Calls into PlayerInventory to reset any perk effects that don't persist between levels.

member.name: M:Player.SetBotbrainLeader(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets which player the bot should follow when using AI control. The bot brain will attempt to follow and support the character of the specified player number. This is used to coordinate AI teammates with human players.
member.param: The player number that this bot should follow. Use -1 for no specific leader.

member.name: M:Player.SetupHud
member.summary: Creates and initializes the player's HUD interface. Instantiates the PlayerHUD prefab, sets it up with current lives and player number, then hides it initially until needed.

member.name: M:Player.Start
member.summary: Performs initial player setup after instantiation. Verifies network connection, sets initial lives based on game mode, requests player data from server if not host, and sets up perks. Handles special cases for hardcore mode, deathmatch, and procedural generation modes.

member.name: P:Player.BotBrainLeader
member.summary: Gets or sets the player number that this bot should follow when using AI control. The bot brain will attempt to follow the character of the specified player number. -1 indicates no specific leader.

member.name: P:Player.UsingBotBrain
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this player is being controlled by AI. When true, the BotBrain component controls the player's character instead of player input. Used for AI-controlled teammates or testing.

member.name: P:Player.controllerNum
member.summary: Gets the controller ID assigned to this player. Returns the controller ID from HeroController.playerControllerIDs based on this player's playerNum. Returns -1 if playerNum is invalid (less than 0).

member.name: F:Player.playerNum
member.summary: The player's unique identifier number in the game session. Ranges from 0-3 for the four possible players. Used as an index into various player arrays like HeroController.players, PlayerInventory arrays, and for network identification. Initialized to -1 until properly set during Awake.

member.name: M:Player.AssignCharacter(TestVanDammeAnim)
member.summary: Assigns a hero character to this player and clears pending state flags. Sets the character reference and resets awaitingHeroTypeFromServer and RescueInProgress flags to false.
member.param: The hero character to assign to this player.

member.name: M:Player.BoostHero(System.Single)
member.summary: Applies a speed boost to the player's hero character for the specified duration. If the player has an active character, calls the character's Boost method which increases movement speed temporarily. This is typically used for power-ups or special abilities that enhance hero mobility.
member.param: The duration in seconds for which the speed boost should last.

member.name: M:Player.DeRegisterMinion(Unit)
member.summary: Removes a unit from this player's minion list. If the unit is currently registered as a minion, removes it from the tracking list. This is typically called when a minion dies or is no longer under the player's control.
member.param: The unit to remove from this player's minion list.

member.name: M:Player.InstantiateHero(HeroType,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new hero instance for the local player only. Instantiates the hero prefab via networking, sets up the hero with player data, calculates spawn position, configures death match HUD if needed, and applies any flex powers. Returns null for non-local players. Note: ProcGenGameMode references are for an unfinished feature.
member.param: The type of hero to instantiate.
The player number who owns this hero.
The controller number assigned to this player.
member.returns: The instantiated hero character, or null if not the local player.

member.name: M:Player.ReRequestHeroTypeFromMasterOnServerMigration
member.summary: Re-requests hero type information from the new master after server migration. Currently empty implementation - appears to be a stub for handling host migration scenarios.

member.name: M:Player.RegisterMinion(Unit)
member.summary: Registers a unit as a minion controlled by this player. Adds the unit to the player's minions list if not already present. Minions are AI-controlled units that fight alongside the player, such as rescued animals or summoned allies.
member.param: The unit to register as a minion of this player.

member.name: M:Player.RespawnBro(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initiates the respawn process for the player's hero. Sets awaitingHeroTypeFromServer flag and requests a hero type from the master/host. The swappingBro parameter indicates if this is a hero swap rather than a death respawn. This is an RPC method that only executes for the local player.
member.param: If true, indicates this is a hero swap rather than a death respawn.

member.name: M:Player.SetHeroType(HeroType)
member.summary: Sets the current hero type and updates the HUD avatar display. Changes the HUD avatar and grenade material to match the specified hero type and sets the avatar to calm state.
member.param: The hero type to set as current.

member.name: M:Player.SetInvulnerable(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the hero character to be invulnerable for the specified duration. Calls the character's SetInvulnerable method with the fadeIn parameter set to true and the showSmoke parameter set to false. This provides temporary protection from damage, typically used after spawning or during special events.
member.param: The duration in seconds for which the character should be invulnerable.

member.name: M:Player.SetSpawnPositon(TestVanDammeAnim,Player.SpawnType,System.Boolean,UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: RPC method that sets the spawn position and state for a hero character. Applies the calculated position, enables parachute if spawning via air drop, plays spawn sounds for non-first deployments, and grants temporary invulnerability. Updates rescue and hero request flags to false.
member.param: The hero character being spawned.
The type of spawn scenario being used.
Whether the hero should spawn with a parachute.
The world position where the hero should spawn.

member.name: M:Player.SpawnHero(HeroType)
member.summary: Spawns a new hero of the specified type for this player. Recalls any existing living hero, handles cutscene loading for newly played heroes, unlocks heroes in campaign mode, and calls InstantiateHero to create the actual character. Updates player progress for unlocked heroes.
member.param: The type of hero to spawn.

member.name: M:Player.TimeBroBoostHero(System.Single)
member.summary: Applies a TimeBro-specific boost effect to the player's hero character. If the player has an active character, calls the character's TimeBroBoost method which provides special time-manipulation abilities. This boost is specific to TimeBro's unique gameplay mechanics.
member.param: The duration in seconds for which the TimeBro boost should last.

member.name: M:Player.WorkOutSpawnPosition(TestVanDammeAnim)
member.summary: Calculates and sets the spawn position for a hero based on the determined spawn scenario. Evaluates the spawn type, retrieves the appropriate position (checkpoint, cage, transport, etc.), and calls SetSpawnPositon via RPC to synchronize the position across all clients. Handles special cases like air drops and level editor reloads.
member.param: The hero character to position for spawning.

member.name: M:Player.WorkOutSpawnScenario
member.summary: Determines the appropriate spawn scenario based on current game state and player conditions. Evaluates various factors including rescue status, game mode, checkpoint activation, and initial deployment to select the correct SpawnType. Returns Unknown type for explosion run mode without first deployment.
member.returns: The SpawnType enum value indicating how the player should spawn.

member.name: P:Player.character
member.summary: Gets or sets the current hero character (TestVanDammeAnim) controlled by this player. This is the actual bro/character unit in the game world that the player controls. Setting this property also updates internal state tracking.

member.name: F:Player._character
member.summary: The current hero character (TestVanDammeAnim) instance controlled by this player. This is the actual bro unit in the game world. Can be null when the player is dead or waiting to spawn. Accessed through the character property which provides additional logic when setting.

member.name: F:Player._forceFlexPowerupSpawn
member.summary: Private field storing a flex power type to be automatically granted when the player spawns a new hero. Set by ForceRespawnWithFlexPower and checked during InstantiateHero to apply the power immediately after spawning. Reset to PickupType.None after use.

member.name: F:Player.heroType
member.summary: The HeroType enum value of the player's current hero. Used for HUD avatar display and tracking which bro the player is currently playing as. Set to HeroType.None when no hero is active. Updated when spawning a new hero via SetHeroType method.

member.name: F:Player.minions
member.summary: List of AI-controlled units that fight alongside this player. Includes rescued animals, summoned allies, or other units under the player's control. Units are added via RegisterMinion and removed via DeRegisterMinion. Used to track and manage AI companions.

member.name: F:Player.recentlyUnlockedHeros
member.summary: List of hero types that were recently unlocked but not yet used by the player. This field appears to be defined but not actively used in the current implementation. Likely intended for tracking newly unlocked bros for UI notifications or achievements.

member.name: M:Player.AddFlexPower(PickupType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a flex power pickup to the player's inventory. Flex powers are temporary power-ups that grant special abilities like invulnerability, air jump, teleport, or golden light. If forced is true, overwrites any existing flex power. If forced is false, only adds if the player has no current flex power. This is an RPC method for network synchronization.
member.param: The type of flex power pickup to add (e.g., FlexInvulnerability, FlexAirJump, FlexTeleport, FlexGoldenLight).
If true, replaces any existing flex power. If false, only adds if no flex power is currently active.

member.name: M:Player.ClearFlexPower
member.summary: Removes the player's current flex power. Calls PlayerInventory.HeroHasDied which clears the flex power from the global inventory. This is typically called when the player dies to ensure flex powers don't persist between lives in campaign mode.

member.name: M:Player.ForceRespawnWithFlexPower(PickupType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a flex power to be automatically applied when the player respawns. Stores the specified pickup type in _forceFlexPowerupSpawn field, which is checked during hero instantiation to grant the power immediately upon spawning. The respawnWithFlexPower parameter is not used in the current implementation.
member.param: The flex power pickup type to grant on respawn.
Unused parameter in current implementation.

member.name: M:Player.GetFlexPower
member.summary: Gets the player's currently active flex power type. Retrieves the flex power from PlayerInventory for this player number.
member.returns: The PickupType of the current flex power, or PickupType.None if no power is active.

member.name: M:Player.HasFlexPower(PickupType)
member.summary: Checks if the player currently has a specific type of flex power. Compares the player's current flex power in PlayerInventory against the specified type.
member.param: The flex power type to check for.
member.returns: True if the player has the specified flex power type, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Player.HasFlexPower
member.summary: Checks if the player currently has any flex power active. Returns true if the player's flex power in PlayerInventory is not None.
member.returns: True if the player has any flex power, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Player.AddLife
member.summary: Adds one life to the player's life count. Only executes for the local player, incrementing Lives and triggering a free life animation on the HUD.

member.name: M:Player.RemoveLife
member.summary: Removes a life from the player based on the current game mode rules. In hardcore mode, moves the hero from available to dead list and may force level restart. In ProcGen mode, decrements global lives and may trigger level failure. In campaign mode, also clears any active flex powers. Updates lives differently for each game mode.

member.name: M:Player.SetLivesRPC(System.Int32)
member.summary: RPC method that sets the player's lives count and updates the HUD. Called by the Lives property setter to synchronize life count across all clients in multiplayer.
member.param: The new lives count to set.

member.name: P:Player.Lives
member.summary: Gets or sets the player's remaining lives count. Handles different game modes: returns/sets hardcore lives for hardcore mode, procedural generation lives for procgen mode, or standard lives otherwise. When setting as the local player, also syncs the value via RPC to other players.

member.name: F:Player.lives
member.summary: Private backing field for the Lives property storing the player's current life count. Initialized to 1 and modified through the Lives property setter which handles RPC synchronization. In standard gameplay this tracks the player's remaining lives, but the Lives property getter may return different values based on game mode (hardcore or procedural generation).

member.name: M:Player.AddPlayerTarget(UnityEngine.Transform)
member.summary: Sets a temporary target transform for this player to focus on. This target overrides normal camera behavior and can be used to direct player attention to specific objects or locations in the game world, such as during scripted sequences or tutorials.
member.param: The transform to set as the temporary target.

member.name: M:Player.GetInput(System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Retrieves input state for all control actions from the appropriate source. If using bot brain, gets AI-generated input. If chat or pause menu is active (based on controller number), returns all false inputs. Otherwise reads input from the physical controller via InputReader. This centralizes all input handling for the player.
member.param: Output parameter set to true if up direction is pressed.
Output parameter set to true if down direction is pressed.
Output parameter set to true if left direction is pressed.
Output parameter set to true if right direction is pressed.
Output parameter set to true if fire button is pressed.
Output parameter set to true if jump button is pressed.
Output parameter set to true if special/grenade button is pressed.
Output parameter set to true if high five button is pressed.
Output parameter set to true if gesture button is pressed.
Output parameter set to true if sprint button is pressed.

member.name: M:Player.HasTemporaryTarget
member.summary: Checks whether this player currently has a temporary target set. Returns true if a temporary target transform is assigned, false otherwise. Used to determine if the camera should follow a special target instead of the player character.
member.returns: True if the player has a temporary target set, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Player.IsRescuingBro
member.summary: Checks if the player is currently rescuing a specific bro. Returns true if rescuingThisBro field is not null, indicating an active rescue operation in progress.
member.returns: True if actively rescuing a bro, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Player.RemovePlayerTarget
member.summary: Clears the temporary target transform for this player. Returns camera focus to normal behavior, typically following the player's character. This is called when a scripted sequence ends or the target object is no longer relevant.

member.name: M:Player.SetRumble(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the controller rumble intensity for force feedback. Updates the rumbleIntensity to the maximum of the current value and the provided amount, ensuring the strongest rumble effect is preserved. The rumble will fade out over time based on the update loop logic.
member.param: The rumble intensity to apply (0 to 1 range).

member.name: P:Player.RescueInProgress
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this player is currently in the process of rescuing a bro. When set to true, starts a 15-second timeout. Used to track rescue operation state and prevent multiple simultaneous rescues.

member.name: P:Player.awaitingHeroTypeFromServer
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the player is waiting for the server to assign a hero type. When set to true, starts a 15-second timeout. Used during respawn/rescue operations to track server response state.

member.name: F:Player._awaitingHeroTypeFromServer
member.summary: Private flag indicating the player is waiting for the server to assign a hero type during respawn. Set via the awaitingHeroTypeFromServer property which also manages the server timeout. Prevents multiple hero requests and tracks respawn state.

member.name: F:Player.changingBroFromTrigger
member.summary: Flag indicating the player is swapping bros via a trigger (like swap bro crates). Checked in WorkOutSpawnScenario to return TriggerSwapBro spawn type, then immediately cleared. Used to maintain position when swapping heroes through game triggers rather than death.

member.name: F:Player.rescueInProgress
member.summary: Private flag indicating whether this player is currently rescuing a bro. Set via the RescueInProgress property which also manages the server timeout. Prevents multiple simultaneous rescue attempts and tracks rescue state for spawn positioning.

member.name: F:Player.rescuingThisBro
member.summary: Reference to the RescueBro object currently being rescued by this player. Set when the player initiates a rescue operation via HeroController.RescueBro or HeroController.SpawnOnPlayer. Used to determine spawn position (RespawnAtRescueBro) and properly destroy the rescue cage when the hero spawns. Null when no rescue is in progress.

member.name: F:Player.rumbleIntensity
member.summary: Current controller vibration intensity (0 to 1 range) for force feedback effects. Set via SetRumble which takes the maximum of current and new values. Automatically decreases by 2 per second in Update loop until reaching 0. Passed to InputReader.SetRumble each frame to apply controller vibration if the player has rumble enabled in options.

member.name: F:Player.serverResponseTimeout
member.summary: Timeout counter for server operations in seconds. Set to 15 seconds when starting a rescue operation or requesting hero type from server. Counts down each frame and clears rescue/hero request flags if it reaches 0, preventing indefinite waiting for server responses.

member.name: M:Player.ActivateHUD
member.summary: Activates and shows the player's HUD if standard HUDs are enabled in the current game mode. Creates the HUD if needed and makes it visible on screen.

member.name: M:Player.DisableHud
member.summary: Hides and deactivates the player's HUD elements. Calls Hide on the HUD, deactivates the HUD game object, and also deactivates the lives text display if it exists.

member.name: M:Player.EnableHud
member.summary: Shows and activates the player's HUD elements if standard HUDs are enabled. Checks GameModeController.ShowStandardHUDS before making the HUD visible, activating the game object and lives text display.

member.name: M:Player.FlashSpecialAmmo
member.summary: Triggers a flash effect on the special ammo/grenade icons in the HUD. Creates the HUD if it doesn't exist, then calls FlashSpecialIcons to provide visual feedback for special ammo changes.

member.name: M:Player.SetAvatarDead(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the HUD to show the player's avatar as dead. Calls the HUD's SetAvatarDead method to update the visual representation of the player's death state.
member.param: Whether this is the primary avatar that died.

member.name: M:Player.SetAvatarSpecialFrame(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets a special animation frame on the player's HUD avatar for a specified duration. Used for special visual effects or states on the HUD avatar display.
member.param: The duration to display the special frame.

member.name: M:Player.SetUpDeathMatchHUD(TestVanDammeAnim)
member.summary: Creates and configures a death match HUD that follows the hero character. Hides the standard HUD, instantiates the death match HUD prefab, sets it up with player lives and number, and parents it to the hero transform at zero offset.
member.param: The hero unit to attach the death match HUD to.

member.name: M:Player.ShowMinusPlum
member.summary: Displays a negative score indicator (plum) on the player's deathmatch HUD. Shows a visual feedback element indicating point loss, typically when the player dies or loses points in deathmatch game modes.

member.name: M:Player.ShowPlusPlum
member.summary: Displays a positive score indicator (plum) on the player's deathmatch HUD. Shows a visual feedback element indicating point gain, typically when the player scores a kill or earns points in deathmatch game modes.

member.name: M:Player.StopAvatarSpecialFrame
member.summary: Stops any active special animation frame on the player's HUD avatar. Returns the avatar display to its normal state by calling StopUsingSpecialFrame on the HUD.

member.name: M:Player.UnlockProcGenCamera
member.summary: Unlocks the procedural generation camera after a delay. Called via Invoke after spawning a hero in ProcGen mode when the player died inside a room. Note: ProcGenGameMode is an unfinished feature.

member.name: F:Player.characterUI
member.summary: Reference to the CharacterUI component on this player game object. Retrieved during Awake and used for character-specific UI functionality. The specific usage of this component is not shown in the available code.

member.name: F:Player.deathMatchHUD
member.summary: The instantiated HUDHeadGear instance for deathmatch modes. Follows the player's character transform and displays game mode specific information. Created from deathMatchHUDPrefab when playing deathmatch and parented to the hero transform.

member.name: F:Player.deathMatchHUDPrefab
member.summary: Prefab reference for the deathmatch-specific HUD that appears above the player's character. Used in deathmatch game modes to show player-specific information like lives and grenades directly on the character rather than in screen corners.

member.name: F:Player.hud
member.summary: The instantiated PlayerHUD instance for this player. Displays lives count, grenade/special ammo count, avatar icon, and perk information. Created from playerHUDPrefab and managed throughout the player's lifetime. Can be null before setup or in certain game modes.

member.name: F:Player.playerHUDPrefab
member.summary: Prefab reference for the standard player HUD interface. Used as a template to instantiate the player's HUD display showing lives, grenades, and other UI elements. Instantiated in SetupHud method when needed.

member.name: M:Player.ReportGib(KillData,DamageObject)
member.summary: Reports when this player gibs (completely destroys) an enemy for perk triggering. If the character is alive, triggers the OnEnemyGibbed perk event with player inventory items and gib data. Gibbing enemies often provides bonus effects or satisfies specific perk conditions.
member.param: Struct containing information about the gibbed unit including damage type.
The damage source object that caused the gib.

member.name: M:Player.ReportGib(Unit)
member.summary: Simplified gib reporting method that takes only the gibbed unit. Currently has an empty implementation after checking if the character exists and is alive. This appears to be an incomplete overload for simpler gib tracking scenarios.
member.param: The unit that was gibbed.

member.name: M:Player.ReportKill(KillData,DamageObject)
member.summary: Reports a kill made by this player's character for statistics and perk triggering. If the character is alive, triggers the OnMookKilled perk event with player inventory items and kill data, then notifies the character of the kill. This tracks combat performance and activates kill-based perks.
member.param: Struct containing information about the killed unit including damage type and whether it was gibbed.
The damage source object that caused the kill.

member.name: M:Player.TriggerPerkEvent(PerkTriggerController.PerkEvent,TestVanDammeAnim)
member.summary: Triggers a perk event for this player with just the hero as context. Passes the event type, player's inventory items, and hero reference to the perk trigger controller. Used for hero-specific events like spawning, death, or ability usage.
member.param: The type of perk event to trigger.
The hero character associated with this event.

member.name: M:Player.TriggerPerkEvent(PerkTriggerController.PerkEvent,TestVanDammeAnim,Mook)
member.summary: Triggers a perk event for this player with hero and mook context. Passes the event type, player's inventory items, hero, and mook references to the perk trigger controller. Used for combat events involving specific enemy interactions.
member.param: The type of perk event to trigger.
The hero character associated with this event.
The mook (enemy) involved in this event.

member.name: M:Player.TriggerPerkEvent(PerkTriggerController.PerkEvent,TestVanDammeAnim,CheckPoint)
member.summary: Triggers a perk event for this player with hero and checkpoint context. Passes the event type, player's inventory items, hero, and checkpoint references to the perk trigger controller. Used for checkpoint-related events like reaching or activating checkpoints.
member.param: The type of perk event to trigger.
The hero character associated with this event.
The checkpoint involved in this event.

member.name: P:Player.PlayerColor
member.summary: Gets the color assigned to this player based on their player number. Retrieves the color from HeroController.GetHeroColor for consistent player identification across UI elements.

member.name: P:Player.ValueOrchestrator
member.summary: Gets the ValueOrchestrator instance for this player from the global PlayerInventory. The ValueOrchestrator manages dynamic value modifications from perks, power-ups, and other sources, calculating final multipliers for various gameplay values like damage, speed, or health.

member.name: M:Player.ClearTimeSinceDeath
member.summary: Resets the death timer to allow continued camera following. Sets timeSinceDeath to timeSinceDeathToFollow value, effectively extending the camera follow duration after death.

member.name: M:Player.Exists
member.summary: Checks if the player has an active character in the game world. Returns true only if the character reference is not null and the character's game object is active in the hierarchy.
member.returns: True if the player has an active character, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Player.GetCharacterPosition
member.summary: Gets the current position of the player's character. Returns the character's transform position if alive, otherwise returns the last known player follow position.
member.returns: The character's current position or last known position if dead.

member.name: M:Player.GetFollowPosition
member.summary: Gets the position the camera should follow for this player. Returns temporary target position if set, otherwise returns the smoothed character position. Updates death timer and follow position for living characters. Falls back to last known position after death.
member.returns: The world position the camera should follow.

member.name: M:Player.HasFollowPosition
member.summary: Determines if this player should be followed by the camera. For local players, returns true if alive or within the death follow time window. For remote players, returns true if alive and instantiated. Tracks time since death to allow brief following after death.
member.returns: True if the camera should follow this player, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Player.IsAlive
member.summary: Determines if the player is considered alive in the game. Returns true if the character exists and is alive, OR if the player is pending respawn/rescue (waiting states count as alive for game logic).
member.returns: True if the player is alive or pending respawn, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Player.IsAliveAndSpawnedHero
member.summary: Checks if the player has a fully spawned and alive hero. More strict than IsAlive - requires the character to exist, be alive, AND have completed spawn position setup.
member.returns: True if the hero is alive and fully spawned, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Player.IsInvulnerable
member.summary: Checks if the player's character is currently invulnerable. Returns the invulnerable state of the character if it exists, false otherwise.
member.returns: True if the character is invulnerable, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Player.IsNearbyActivatedCheckPoint(UnityEngine.Vector2@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Checks if the player's character is near an activated checkpoint and gets the checkpoint position. Delegates to Map.IsNearActivatedCheckPoint using the character's current position. Modifies the ref parameters with checkpoint data if found.
member.param: Output parameter that receives the checkpoint position if one is found nearby.
Output parameter that indicates if the checkpoint requires air drop spawning.
member.returns: True if near an activated checkpoint, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Player.IsNearbyActivatedCheckPoint(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Checks if the player's character is near an activated checkpoint without retrieving position. Overload that only returns whether an air drop spawn is required, without the checkpoint position.
member.param: Output parameter that indicates if the checkpoint requires air drop spawning.
member.returns: True if near an activated checkpoint, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Player.IsPendingRespawnOrResuingInProgress
member.summary: Checks if the player is in a pending state waiting for respawn or rescue. Returns true if either RescueInProgress or awaitingHeroTypeFromServer flags are set.
member.returns: True if waiting for respawn or in rescue process, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Player.IsThisWay(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if the player's character is in the specified direction from a given position. Special handling for Snake Broskin's grenade hologram position. Returns true if the character (or hologram) is in the direction indicated by xDirection from the given coordinates.
member.param: The X coordinate to check from.
The Y coordinate to check from.
The direction to check (-1 for left, 1 for right).
member.returns: True if the character is in the specified direction, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Player.LateUpdate
member.summary: Late update processing that occurs after all Update calls. Calls base class LateUpdate and then updates the smoothed follow position for camera tracking.

member.name: M:Player.PackState(UnityStream)
member.summary: Serializes the player's state for network synchronization. Packs the current lives count, character reference, and firstDeployment flag into the stream, then calls the base class PackState. This method is used to sync player state across the network in multiplayer games. Note: Network functionality may not work reliably in mods.
member.param: The Unity network stream to write the state data to.
member.returns: The stream with the serialized player state.

member.name: M:Player.UnpackState(UnityStream)
member.summary: Deserializes the player's state from network data. Reads lives count, character reference, and firstDeployment flag from the stream, enables the HUD with updated data, then calls the base class UnpackState. This method receives player state updates in multiplayer games. Note: Network functionality may not work reliably in mods.
member.param: The Unity network stream to read the state data from.
member.returns: The stream after reading the player state.

member.name: M:Player.Update
member.summary: Main update loop for the player. Handles idle timeout detection (35 seconds), controller rumble, server response timeouts, fuel/grenade HUD updates, and bot brain management. Monitors player input to detect AFK players in multiplayer and manages various time-based states.

member.name: M:Player.UpdateSmoothFollowPos
member.summary: Updates the smoothed follow position used for camera tracking. For local players, directly uses character position. For remote players, smoothly interpolates position unless the character has moved too far (200 units squared), in which case it snaps to the new position.

member.name: F:Player.AFKTimeLimit
member.summary: Constant defining the idle time limit before a player is considered AFK (Away From Keyboard). Set to 35 seconds. When idleTimer reaches this value in multiplayer games, the player is automatically dropped out and an AFK message is displayed. This prevents inactive players from blocking game progress.

member.name: F:Player.SmoothedFollowPosition
member.summary: The interpolated position used for smooth camera following. For local players, directly matches character position. For remote players, smoothly interpolates toward the character position unless they teleport (move more than 200 units). Initialized to -Vector3.one and updated in UpdateSmoothFollowPos.

member.name: F:Player.charHasBeenInstantiated
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the player's character has completed at least one update cycle. Set to true in Update when character exists and UpdateHasRunAtleastOnce is true. Used by remote players in HasFollowPosition to determine if the character is ready for camera following. Ensures character is fully initialized before certain operations.

member.name: F:Player.firstDeployment
member.summary: Tracks whether this is the player's first spawn in the current level. Initialized to true and set to false after first spawn. Used to determine spawn behavior (transport vs checkpoint), suppress spawn sounds, and handle special first-spawn logic. Reset between levels.

member.name: F:Player.idleTimer
member.summary: Tracks how long the player has been idle (no input) in seconds. Incremented by unscaled delta time when the player has no input in multiplayer games with other alive players. Reset to 0 when any input is detected. When this reaches AFKTimeLimit (35 seconds), triggers automatic dropout and shows AFK message.

member.name: F:Player.playerDelay
member.summary: Timer field that counts down in the Update loop. Decremented by deltaTime each frame when greater than 0. The specific purpose is not clear from the available code, but appears to be a general-purpose delay timer for player actions.

member.name: F:Player.playerTemporaryTarget
member.summary: Optional transform that overrides normal camera following behavior. When set, the camera will follow this target instead of the player's character. Used for scripted sequences, cutscenes, or directing player attention to specific objects. Cleared with RemovePlayerTarget.

member.name: F:Player.timeSinceDeath
member.summary: Tracks elapsed time in seconds since the player's character died. Incremented in HasFollowPosition for local players after death. Reset to 0 when character is alive and updating. Used with timeSinceDeathToFollow to allow brief camera following after death before switching to other players. Can be reset via ClearTimeSinceDeath.

member.name: F:Player.timeSinceDeathToFollow
member.summary: The duration in seconds to continue following a dead player's last position. Set to 1.5 seconds by default. After a player dies, the camera continues following their position for this duration before switching to other players. This provides visual continuity and lets players see the immediate aftermath of their death.

member.name: M:Projectile.Awake
member.summary: Initializes layer masks, barrier layers, and projectile configuration during Unity's Awake phase. Sets up collision layers for ground, fragile objects, and team-specific barriers, initializes z-offset from transform position, and establishes random seed for deterministic effects.

member.name: M:Projectile.Start
member.summary: Initializes damage background counter with a random offset between 0 and 0.2 seconds. This creates variation in when projectiles start damaging background elements.

member.name: M:Projectile.Update
member.summary: Main update loop that drives projectile behavior. Calls RunProjectile and RunLife methods each frame with the current delta time to process movement, collision, and lifetime.

member.name: F:Projectile.barrierLayer
member.summary: Layer mask for enemy barrier detection. Set during Awake to include "MobileBarriers" and "IndestructibleGround" layers. Used to detect barriers that can reflect player projectiles, changing their ownership and increasing damage.

member.name: F:Projectile.fragileLayer
member.summary: Layer mask for fragile/destructible object detection. Set to "DirtyHippie" layer during Awake. Used to detect breakable objects like doors and crates that projectiles can damage or destroy on contact.

member.name: F:Projectile.friendlyBarrierLayer
member.summary: Layer mask for player-created barrier detection. Set to "FriendlyBarriers" layer during Awake. Used to detect barriers that can reflect enemy projectiles, converting them to player-owned projectiles with increased damage.

member.name: F:Projectile.groundLayer
member.summary: Layer mask for ground and solid object collision detection. Set during Awake to include "Ground", "LargeObjects", and "FLUI" layers. Used in raycast operations to detect walls and terrain that should stop or reflect projectiles.

member.name: F:Projectile.random
member.summary: Random number generator instance for deterministic projectile variations. Initialized in Awake with either a random seed (0-10000) or the specified seed value. Used to create small random offsets for damage timing and other projectile behaviors that need to be consistent across clients.

member.name: F:Projectile.seed
member.summary: Seed value for deterministic random number generation. Set via the SetSeed method to ensure synchronized projectile behavior across networked games. Used to initialize the random field for consistent randomization of effects and variations.

member.name: F:Projectile.t
member.summary: Delta time value for frame-independent movement calculations. Initialized to 0.011f and updated each frame with clamped Time.deltaTime (maximum 0.0334f). Used throughout the projectile system for consistent movement and timing regardless of framerate.

member.name: F:Projectile.zOffset
member.summary: Z-axis rendering offset for visual depth variation. Randomly set between -0.04 and 0.04 in Awake, or can be overridden during Fire method. Applied to transform position to create slight 3D depth effect and prevent z-fighting when multiple projectiles overlap.

member.name: M:Projectile.Bounce(UnityEngine.RaycastHit)
member.summary: Reverses the projectile's Y velocity to create a bounce effect off surfaces. Sets the Y velocity to its absolute value, ensuring upward movement after bounce. Updates projectile rotation to match new trajectory.
member.param: Information about the surface that was hit

member.name: M:Projectile.Damage(System.Int32,DamageType,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Applies damage to this projectile if it's damageable. Reduces projectile damage by the incoming damage amount and destroys the projectile if damage reaches zero. Only processes damage for projectiles marked with isDamageable flag.
member.param: Amount of damage to apply to the projectile
Type of damage being applied
X force component (unused)
Y force component (unused)
Delay before damage is applied (unused)
Player number applying the damage (unused)

member.name: M:Projectile.HitFragile
member.summary: Processes collision with fragile/destructible objects. Uses sphere overlap to detect fragile objects within projectile radius and applies damage to each one found. Called during projectile movement to handle destruction of breakable terrain.

member.name: M:Projectile.HitGrenades
member.summary: Detects and interacts with grenades within projectile radius if canHitGrenades is enabled. Uses Map.KnockAndDamageGrenades to apply knockback force based on projectile velocity. Only processes for projectiles with projectileSize greater than 3.

member.name: M:Projectile.HitHorizontalWalls
member.summary: Specialized collision detection for wide projectiles against horizontal walls. Uses three parallel raycasts (center, up, down) spaced by projectileSize. Only active when horizontalProjectile is set to true.

member.name: M:Projectile.HitOil
member.summary: Checks for oil particles and oily terrain at the projectile's position. Ignites any oil found using EffectsController.IgniteOilParticles within a 24-unit radius. Also ignites oily blocks detected via raycast collision.

member.name: M:Projectile.HitProjectiles
member.summary: Checks for collisions with other projectiles in the vicinity. Uses Map.HitProjectiles to detect and handle projectile-on-projectile interactions within the projectile's radius.

member.name: M:Projectile.HitUnits
member.summary: Detects and damages enemy units within the projectile's area. Uses Map.HitUnits with projectile ownership to find valid targets. Awards deflection achievement if projectile was reflected and kills an enemy. Destroys projectile on successful hit.

member.name: M:Projectile.HitWalls
member.summary: Performs raycast collision detection against walls in the projectile's path. Handles standard wall impacts by applying damage, creating effects, and destroying the projectile. Special handling for depleted uranium perk creates 24-radius explosions on impact. Returns true if wall was hit.
member.returns: True if the projectile hit a wall and was destroyed, false otherwise

member.name: M:Projectile.HitWildLife
member.summary: Checks for and damages wildlife units within the projectile's radius. Destroys the projectile with effects if any wildlife is hit. Uses Map.DamageWildLife to apply damage to animals.

member.name: M:Projectile.MakeSparkShower(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates an intense shower of spark particles at the specified position. Generates 12 sparks with randomized velocities based on the provided shower direction. Each spark has high initial velocity (250+ units) for dramatic visual effect.
member.param: X position to create sparks
Y position to create sparks
Base X velocity for spark shower direction
Base Y velocity for spark shower direction

member.name: M:Projectile.ProjectileApplyDamageToBlock(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Int32,DamageType,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Applies damage to terrain blocks with special handling for depleted uranium perks. Creates a 24-radius explosion for player projectiles with depleted uranium, otherwise applies standard block damage. Handles oil ignition for fire damage types.
member.param: The block GameObject to damage
Amount of damage to apply
Type of damage being applied
X component of impact force
Y component of impact force

member.name: M:Projectile.ReflectProjectile(UnityEngine.RaycastHit)
member.summary: Reflects the projectile off barriers with complex angle calculations and damage bonuses. Changes projectile ownership, adds +12 damage, plays reflection sound, and calculates reflection angle based on impact normal and projectile direction. Awards achievement for deflection kills. Returns false if canReflect is disabled.
member.param: Raycast hit information containing impact point and surface normal
member.returns: True if projectile was successfully reflected, false if reflection is disabled

member.name: M:Projectile.RunDamageBackground(System.Single)
member.summary: Periodically damages background doodads along the projectile's path. Uses a timer that triggers every 0.033 seconds, checking and damaging doodads within 3 units of the projectile position. Only processes if affectScenery is enabled.
member.param: Delta time for this frame

member.name: F:Projectile.damage
member.summary: Base damage value for the projectile. Default value is 1. This is the initial damage setting that gets copied to damageInternal during initialization and can be modified by SetDamage method. Represents the projectile's intended damage before any modifiers.

member.name: F:Projectile.damageInternal
member.summary: The actual damage value used in calculations. Initially set from the damage field, but can be modified by fadeDamage mechanics, reflection bonuses (+12), or other gameplay effects. This is the value actually applied when the projectile hits targets.

member.name: F:Projectile.damageType
member.summary: Specifies the type of damage this projectile inflicts (e.g., Bullet, Fire, Explosion). Passed to all damage application methods to determine appropriate hit reactions, visual effects, and special damage behaviors like oil ignition for fire damage.

member.name: F:Projectile.fadeDamage
member.summary: When enabled, causes projectile damage to decrease proportionally with remaining life. Uses the formula damageInternal = fullDamage * (life/fullLife) to create projectiles that weaken over distance. Special interaction with BulletSnakeBroskin weapon type.

member.name: F:Projectile.firedBy
member.summary: Reference to the MonoBehaviour (usually a unit) that created this projectile. Used for damage attribution, preventing self-collision at spawn, and special behaviors like inseminator targeting. Can be modified by return zones and reflection mechanics.

member.name: F:Projectile.fullDamage
member.summary: Stores the original damage value at projectile initialization. Used with fadeDamage mechanic to calculate damage reduction over time using the formula: damage = fullDamage * (life/fullLife). Preserves the initial damage for percentage calculations.

member.name: F:Projectile.playerNum
member.summary: Identifies which player fired this projectile. Value of -1 indicates enemy projectile, 0-3 indicates player 1-4, and 5 indicates a reflected projectile. Used for friendly fire checks, material selection, and damage attribution. Modified during reflection.

member.name: F:Projectile.unitHit
member.summary: Reference to the last unit hit by this projectile. While this field exists in the base Projectile class, it is not actively used and is likely intended for derived classes that need to track specific hit targets.

member.name: M:Projectile.Death
member.summary: Handles projectile destruction with appropriate effects. Creates visual impact effects at the projectile's position, plays death sound if configured, and destroys the GameObject.

member.name: M:Projectile.IncreaseLife(System.Single)
member.summary: Extends the projectile's remaining lifetime by a multiplier. Increases both current life and maximum life values proportionally, allowing projectiles to travel further before expiring.
member.param: Multiplier to apply to the projectile's life (e.g., 2.0 doubles remaining life)

member.name: M:Projectile.MakeEffects(System.Boolean,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Creates visual effects when the projectile impacts. Generates sparks with physics-based trajectories, optional puff effects, and plays impact sounds. Supports both raycast-based hit information and position-only effects. Only creates effects once unless canMakeEffectsMoreThanOnce is enabled.
member.param: Whether to create particle effects (currently unused)
X position for the effects
Y position for the effects
Whether to use raycast hit information for effect direction
Normal vector of the surface hit (used if useRayCast is true)
Exact point of impact (used if useRayCast is true)

member.name: M:Projectile.MoveProjectile
member.summary: Updates the projectile's position based on current velocity and delta time. Applies doubled movement when doubleSpeed is enabled, effectively moving the projectile twice per frame for increased speed. Handles Z-axis positioning for rendering depth.

member.name: M:Projectile.OnDestroy
member.summary: Cleanup method called when the projectile GameObject is destroyed. Deregisters the projectile from the Map system and calls base class cleanup.

member.name: M:Projectile.PlayDeathSound
member.summary: Plays the projectile's death sound effect if a sound holder is configured. Uses the projectile's position and configured volume, with playback priority of 0.65.

member.name: M:Projectile.RunLife(System.Single)
member.summary: Manages projectile lifetime countdown and destruction. Decrements life by delta time each frame, applying damage fade if enabled. When life reaches zero or damage fades completely, destroys the projectile with appropriate effects.
member.param: Delta time for this frame

member.name: M:Projectile.RunProjectile(System.Single)
member.summary: Core projectile update method that processes movement, collision detection, and damage application. Handles projectile physics, checks for unit/terrain hits, applies damage to background elements, manages return zone interactions, and processes special behaviors like reversing. Updates position based on velocity and delta time.
member.param: Delta time for this frame

member.name: M:Projectile.SetDoubleSpeed
member.summary: Activates double speed mode for the projectile. Limits the projectile's life to a maximum of 1 second and enables the doubleSpeed flag which causes MoveProjectile to update position twice per frame.

member.name: P:Projectile.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the projectile's 2D position. Setting the position updates both the X and Y coordinates and immediately applies the new position to the transform. Getting returns the current X,Y as a Vector2.

member.name: P:Projectile.Velocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the projectile's 2D velocity vector. Setting velocity updates both xI and yI components and recalculates the projectile's rotation to match the new direction. Getting returns xI,yI as a Vector2.

member.name: F:Projectile.affectScenery
member.summary: Controls whether this projectile can damage background scenery and doodads. Default is true. When disabled, the projectile passes through destructible background elements without affecting them. Checked in RunDamageBackground method.

member.name: F:Projectile.canHitGrenades
member.summary: Determines if this projectile can interact with grenades. Default is true. When enabled, the projectile will knock back and potentially damage grenades it encounters. Only applies to projectiles with projectileSize greater than 3.

member.name: F:Projectile.canMakeEffectsMoreThanOnce
member.summary: When enabled, allows MakeEffects to create visual effects multiple times during the projectile's lifetime. Works with hasMadeEffects flag to control whether effects can be repeated for projectiles that hit multiple targets or surfaces.

member.name: F:Projectile.damageBackgroundCounter
member.summary: Timer controlling periodic background damage checks. Initialized with a small random negative value (-0.2 to 0) and increments by delta time. When positive, triggers background damage check every 0.033 seconds if affectScenery is enabled.

member.name: F:Projectile.damagedBackground
member.summary: Flag tracking whether this projectile has already damaged background elements. Prevents multiple damage applications to scenery during a single projectile's lifetime. Set to true after first background damage event.

member.name: F:Projectile.doubleSpeed
member.summary: Speed multiplier flag that doubles projectile movement when enabled. Set via SetDoubleSpeed method which also caps projectile life at 1 second. Applied in MoveProjectile to effectively move the projectile twice per frame.

member.name: F:Projectile.flickPuff
member.summary: Puff effect prefab created when the projectile damages background scenery or doodads. Instantiated by EffectsController.CreateProjectilePuff during background damage checks to provide visual feedback for environmental destruction.

member.name: F:Projectile.fullLife
member.summary: Original lifetime value stored at projectile initialization. Used with fadeDamage to calculate damage reduction over time and preserved for any mechanics that need to reference the projectile's initial lifetime setting.

member.name: F:Projectile.hasHit
member.summary: Flag indicating the projectile has already hit a target. Set to true on successful collision to prevent multiple hit registrations from the same impact. Ensures projectiles only deal damage once per target.

member.name: F:Projectile.hasMadeEffects
member.summary: Tracks whether visual impact effects have been created. Prevents duplicate effect spawning unless canMakeEffectsMoreThanOnce is enabled. Set to true after first effect creation in MakeEffects method.

member.name: F:Projectile.isDamageable
member.summary: Indicates whether this projectile can be damaged and destroyed by attacks. While this field exists in the base class, it is not actively used in the base implementation and is likely intended for derived projectile types that can be shot down.

member.name: F:Projectile.life
member.summary: Remaining lifetime of the projectile in seconds. Default value is 4 seconds. Decreases by delta time each frame and destroys the projectile when it reaches zero. Can be modified by SetDoubleSpeed (caps at 1 second) and IncreaseLife methods.

member.name: F:Projectile.projectileSize
member.summary: Collision radius of the projectile in units. Default value is 8. Used for all sphere-based collision checks, hit detection radii, and raycast distances. Larger values create projectiles that can hit targets more easily and affect wider areas.

member.name: F:Projectile.shrapnel
member.summary: Shrapnel prefab reference for creating debris particles. While not directly used in the base Projectile class, this field is available for derived projectile types to create custom shrapnel effects on impact.

member.name: F:Projectile.shrapnelSpark
member.summary: Spark shrapnel prefab reference for creating spark particles. While not directly used in the base Projectile class, this field is available for derived projectile types to create custom spark effects, particularly for metal impacts.

member.name: F:Projectile.sound
member.summary: Lazy-initialized Sound instance for playing projectile audio effects. Created on demand in PlayDeathSound when the projectile is destroyed. Cached to avoid creating multiple Sound objects for the same projectile.

member.name: F:Projectile.soundHolder
member.summary: Reference to the SoundHolder component containing this projectile's sound effects. Used in PlayDeathSound to play impact sounds when the projectile is destroyed. Configured per projectile type for unique audio feedback.

member.name: F:Projectile.soundVolume
member.summary: Volume level for projectile sound effects. Default value is 0.2f (20% volume). Applied when playing death sounds through the sound holder to control audio levels relative to other game sounds.

member.name: F:Projectile.sparkCount
member.summary: Number of spark particles created on impact. Default value is 10. Used in MakeEffects to determine how many sparks to generate. Different impact contexts use full count or reduced counts for visual variety.

member.name: F:Projectile.startProjectileSpeed
member.summary: Initial speed magnitude of the projectile when fired. Default 400f but set from velocity vector magnitude in Fire method. Used in collision prediction calculations to determine raycast distances based on projectile speed.

member.name: F:Projectile.whitePopEffect
member.summary: Determines the type of impact effect created. When true, creates a white pop effect instead of the standard projectile pop effect. Used in MakeEffects to provide visual variety for different projectile types.

member.name: F:Projectile.z
member.summary: The projectile's Z-axis position used for rendering depth. Updated during movement to maintain proper visual layering with other game objects.

member.name: M:Projectile.Fire(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour)
member.summary: Primary initialization method that launches the projectile. Sets position, velocity, player ownership, and performs comprehensive spawn validation including collision checks, unit hits, and barrier reflections. Applies perk-based scaling for player projectiles and sets appropriate team materials.
member.param: Starting X position of the projectile
Starting Y position of the projectile
Initial X velocity
Initial Y velocity
Z-axis offset for rendering depth
Player number who fired the projectile (0-3 for players, -1 for enemies)
Reference to the unit that fired this projectile

member.name: M:Projectile.GetSuggestedSpeed
member.summary: Returns the suggested default speed for projectiles, used as a baseline for velocity calculations. Standard projectiles return 120 units per second.
member.returns: The suggested projectile speed (120f)

member.name: M:Projectile.SetDamage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the projectile's damage value, updating both the internal damage tracking and the public damage field used for display and calculations.
member.param: The damage value to set

member.name: M:Projectile.SetPosition
member.summary: Updates the projectile's transform position using rounded X and Y coordinates with the configured z-offset for proper rendering depth.

member.name: M:Projectile.SetRotation
member.summary: Calculates and applies rotation to the projectile's transform based on its current velocity. Uses atan2 to determine angle from velocity vector and converts to degrees. Applies an additional 180-degree rotation for horizontal projectiles.

member.name: M:Projectile.SetSeed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the random seed for this projectile, creating a new Randomf instance with the specified seed for deterministic random behavior in effects and variations.
member.param: The seed value for random number generation

member.name: M:Projectile.SetSpeed(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Updates the projectile's velocity vector and recalculates its rotation to match the new direction of travel.
member.param: New X velocity component
New Y velocity component

member.name: F:Projectile.canReflect
member.summary: Controls whether this projectile can be reflected by barriers. Default is true. When disabled, projectile ignores barrier collision checks that would normally cause reflection. Used to create projectiles that pass through or are destroyed by barriers instead of bouncing off.

member.name: F:Projectile.enemyMaterial
member.summary: Material applied to enemy-fired projectiles for visual team identification. Set through CheckFriendlyFireMaterial when playerNum is negative. Creates visual distinction between projectiles that can harm the player versus those that cannot.

member.name: F:Projectile.friendlyMaterial
member.summary: Material applied to player-fired projectiles for visual team identification. Set through CheckFriendlyFireMaterial when playerNum is 0 or greater. Helps players distinguish between friendly and enemy projectiles at a glance.

member.name: F:Projectile.horizontalProjectile
member.summary: Determines raycast behavior for collision detection. Default is true. When true, uses offset raycasts from projectile sides for barrier detection. When false, uses direct center raycasts. Affects how projectiles interact with barriers and walls.

member.name: F:Projectile.isWideProjectile
member.summary: Indicates if this is a wide projectile that requires special collision handling. When true, skips horizontal wall collision checks. Used in conjunction with horizontalProjectile to determine appropriate collision detection methods.

member.name: M:Projectile.CheckSpawnPoint
member.summary: Comprehensive spawn point validation that checks for walls, doodads, return zones, barriers, and units at the projectile's starting position. Handles barrier reflections for both enemy and friendly projectiles, destroys projectile if spawning inside solid objects, and attempts to hit units at spawn location. Registers projectile with Map system if spawn is valid.

member.name: M:Projectile.CheckSpawnPointFragile
member.summary: Checks for fragile/destructible objects at spawn location using a 5-unit radius sphere overlap. Creates puff effects and applies damage to all fragile objects found, but does not destroy the projectile.

member.name: M:Projectile.CheckWallsAtSpawnPoint
member.summary: Checks for wall collisions at the projectile's spawn position using a 5-unit radius sphere overlap. Applies damage to any walls found (excluding the firing unit's collider) and destroys the projectile if walls are hit, creating appropriate impact effects.
member.returns: True if walls were hit and projectile was destroyed, false otherwise

member.name: M:Projectile.TryHitUnitsAtSpawn
member.summary: Attempts to damage units at the projectile's spawn location. Handles special case for inseminator units (alien face huggers) by targeting their host unit with double damage. Destroys projectile with effects if any units are successfully hit.

member.name: F:Projectile.raycastHit
member.summary: Stores the result of raycast collision detection operations. Contains hit point, surface normal, collider reference, and other collision data used for creating effects, calculating reflections, and applying damage at the correct position and angle.

member.name: M:Projectile.AvoidRect(UnityEngine.Transform,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Virtual method for implementing projectile avoidance behavior around rectangular areas. Base implementation is empty - derived projectile types override this to steer around obstacles.
member.param: Transform of the rectangle to avoid
Width of the avoidance area
Height of the avoidance area

member.name: M:Projectile.CheckFriendlyFireMaterial
member.summary: Updates the projectile's visual material based on team affiliation. Player projectiles (playerNum >= 0) use the friendly material if available, while enemy projectiles use the enemy material. Helps players identify projectile ownership visually.

member.name: M:Projectile.CheckReturnZones
member.summary: Scans for nearby ProjectileReturnZones that can capture and reverse this projectile. Only captures enemy projectiles (playerNum -1) within 64 units of an active zone. Initiates reversal behavior when a valid zone is found.
member.returns: True if the projectile was captured by a return zone, false otherwise

member.name: M:Projectile.IsHeldByZone
member.summary: Checks if this projectile is currently being held and reversed by a return zone. Returns true when the projectile has an active zone reference and is in reversing state.
member.returns: True if held by a return zone, false otherwise

member.name: M:Projectile.ReverseProjectile
member.summary: Initiates projectile reversal toward its firing unit. Sets reverse velocity targets to 80% of negative initial velocity, creating a boomerang effect. Only reverses if the original firing unit still exists.

member.name: M:Projectile.RunReversing
member.summary: Handles projectile reversal behavior when captured by return zones. Gradually adjusts velocity toward the zone's return point using interpolation. Destroys the projectile when it gets within 16 units of the target position.

member.name: M:Projectile.Target(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Virtual method for implementing projectile targeting behavior. Base implementation is empty - guided projectile types override this to track toward specified coordinates.
member.param: X coordinate of the target position
Y coordinate of the target position
Player number associated with the targeting

member.name: P:Projectile.StopBeingControlled
member.summary: Virtual property that indicates whether the projectile should stop being controlled by external systems. Base implementation always returns false, but can be overridden by guided projectiles to signal when they should stop tracking targets.

member.name: F:Projectile.giveDeflectAchievementOnMookKill
member.summary: When enabled, awards the "bronald_bradman" achievement if this deflected projectile kills an enemy. Checked in HitUnits when the projectile successfully damages a target. Used to track player skill in deflecting enemy projectiles back at enemies.

member.name: F:Projectile.heldDelay
member.summary: Random delay before reversed projectile starts moving. Set to 0-0.333 seconds when caught by a return zone. Decrements each frame in RunReversing, creating a brief pause before the projectile reverses direction.

member.name: F:Projectile.reverseXI
member.summary: Target X velocity for projectile reversal. Set to 80% of negative current X velocity when reversal begins. Used in RunReversing for smooth interpolation from current to reversed trajectory.

member.name: F:Projectile.reverseYI
member.summary: Target Y velocity for projectile reversal. Set to 80% of negative current Y velocity when reversal begins. Used in RunReversing for smooth interpolation from current to reversed trajectory.

member.name: F:Projectile.reversing
member.summary: Indicates the projectile is being reversed by a return zone (like Brondleman's ability). Set to true when captured by a ProjectileReturnZone. Triggers special movement behavior in RunReversing that gradually redirects the projectile.

member.name: F:Projectile.zone
member.summary: Reference to the ProjectileReturnZone currently controlling this projectile. Set when the projectile enters a return zone's area of effect. Used to determine if the projectile should continue reversing behavior or has escaped the zone's influence.

member.name: M:Projectile.DeregisterProjectile
member.summary: Removes this projectile from the Map's projectile tracking system, typically called during cleanup when the projectile is destroyed.

member.name: M:Projectile.RegisterProjectile
member.summary: Registers this projectile with the Map's projectile tracking system, allowing it to be found by other game systems for collision detection and effects.

member.name: M:ProjectileController.Awake
member.summary: Unity's Awake method that initializes mathematical lookup tables when the ProjectileController is first created.

member.name: P:ProjectileController.instance
member.summary: Gets the singleton instance of ProjectileController. Uses lazy initialization to find or create the instance when first accessed.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.inst
member.summary: Private static field that stores the singleton instance of ProjectileController.

member.name: M:ProjectileController.SpawnGrenadeLocally(Grenade,UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Spawns a grenade locally without network synchronization. Sets up the grenade with physics parameters and launches it.
member.param: The grenade prefab to instantiate.
The MonoBehaviour that threw this grenade.
The X position to spawn the grenade.
The Y position to spawn the grenade.
The explosion radius of the grenade (passed to SetupGrenade but actual usage depends on grenade type).
The explosion force of the grenade (passed to SetupGrenade but actual usage depends on grenade type).
The initial X velocity of the grenade.
The initial Y velocity of the grenade.
The player number who owns this grenade.
Random seed for deterministic grenade behavior.
member.returns: The spawned Grenade instance.

member.name: M:ProjectileController.SpawnGrenadeOverNetwork(Grenade,UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Spawns a grenade across the network for multiplayer synchronization. Creates the grenade and sends RPCs to set it up and launch it on all clients. Note: Network functionality may not work reliably in mods.
member.param: The grenade prefab to instantiate.
The MonoBehaviour that threw this grenade.
The X position to spawn the grenade.
The Y position to spawn the grenade.
The explosion radius (usage depends on grenade type).
The explosion force (usage depends on grenade type).
The initial X velocity of the grenade.
The initial Y velocity of the grenade.
The player number who owns this grenade.
Life multiplier for the grenade. Values less than 1 reduce the grenade's fuse time.
member.returns: The spawned Grenade instance.

member.name: M:ProjectileController.SpawnLaserBeamLocally(LaserBeam,UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Spawns a laser beam locally without network synchronization. Creates a laser beam with specified angle and rotation parameters.
member.param: The laser beam prefab to instantiate.
The MonoBehaviour that created this laser beam.
The X position to spawn the laser beam.
The Y position to spawn the laser beam.
The Z position to spawn the laser beam.
The initial angle of the laser beam in degrees.
How long the laser beam should last in seconds.
The rotation speed of the laser beam in degrees per second.
The player number who owns this laser beam.
member.returns: The spawned LaserBeam instance.

member.name: M:ProjectileController.SpawnLaserBeamOverNetwork(LaserBeam,UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,UnityEngine.Transform,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Spawns a laser beam across the network for multiplayer synchronization. Can target a specific transform. Note: Network functionality may not work reliably in mods.
member.param: The laser beam prefab to instantiate.
The MonoBehaviour that created this laser beam.
The X position to spawn the laser beam.
The Y position to spawn the laser beam.
The Z position to spawn the laser beam.
How long the laser beam should last in seconds.
Optional transform for the laser to track/target.
Whether to enable continuous network synchronization.
The player number who owns this laser beam.
Whether to execute the network commands immediately.
member.returns: The spawned LaserBeam instance.

Shared with SpecialAbilitiesController for consistent access.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.alienPheromoneGrenade

Available as pocketed special ammunition pickup. Uses stance-based throwing system (crouching: 30/70 for close range, standing: 200/150 for long range) and shares animation behavior with airstrike and mech drop abilities.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.allGrenadePrefabs

member.summary: Unity Inspector field containing references to all projectile prefabs in the game. Not referenced in code but likely populated via Unity Editor for cataloging, validation, or potential editor tooling purposes. Initialized as empty list in code.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.Awake
member.summary: Unity Awake callback that initializes the sprite system. Creates normals, gets the mesh renderer component, initializes the animations array if null, builds all UV animations, and calls base initialization. This ensures all sprite components are properly set up before Start is called.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.OnDrawGizmos
member.summary: Unity editor callback that monitors sprite changes during edit mode. Creates and maintains a SpriteMirror instance to detect property changes, automatically reinitializing the sprite when modifications are detected to ensure real-time preview updates in the editor.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.Start
member.summary: Unity Start callback that plays the default animation if configured. Checks if playAnimOnStart is true, defaultAnim is within the animations array bounds, and the application is playing (not in editor mode). This allows sprites to automatically start animating when the game begins.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.Clear
member.summary: Clears the sprite state by calling base clear functionality and stopping any current animation. If an animation is playing, it pauses the animation and sets the current animation reference to null. This effectively resets the sprite to its initial non-animated state.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.Copy(SpriteBase)
member.summary: Copies all settings from another SpriteSM instance. Copies base sprite properties, lower left pixel, pixel dimensions, bleed compensation, and size settings. Also duplicates the entire animations array and rebuilds all UV animations for this sprite. This creates a complete duplicate of the source sprite's visual configuration.
member.param: The source sprite to copy settings from. Must be a SpriteSM instance.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetTextureDefaults
member.summary: Sets the sprite to use the full texture dimensions as defaults. Recalculates the texture reference, sets the lower left pixel to (0, texture.height), sets the sprite size to match the texture dimensions, updates pixel dimensions, calculates UVs, and updates the mesh UVs. This is useful for initializing a sprite to display an entire texture without manual configuration.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.lockWidthAndHeight
member.summary: When true, forces the sprite's world size to exactly match its pixel dimensions. Overrides autoResize behavior and ensures 1:1 pixel-to-unit scaling regardless of other size calculation settings.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.meshRender
member.summary: Cached reference to the Renderer component on this GameObject. Used for accessing the material and texture during trim operations and pixel sampling. Initialized during Awake.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.mirror
member.summary: SpriteMirror instance used exclusively in the editor to detect property changes. Stores a snapshot of sprite properties and compares them each frame to automatically reinitialize the sprite when modifications occur.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.refreshMeshNow
member.summary: Editor flag that forces an immediate mesh update when set to true. Used in editor scripts to trigger sprite recreation after property changes without waiting for the next update cycle.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.CalcUVs
member.summary: Calculates the UV coordinates for the sprite based on pixel coordinates. Converts the lower left pixel position to UV space and sets the UV rect's position. Then converts pixel dimensions to UV space and sets the UV rect's size. This mapping allows the sprite to display the correct portion of its texture.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetLowerLeftPixel(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the lower left pixel coordinate of the sprite on the texture and recalculates all UV mappings. Updates the UV rect position and size based on the new pixel coordinates, applies bleed compensation, and optionally recalculates the sprite size if auto-resize or pixel-perfect mode is enabled.
member.param: The pixel coordinates of the lower left corner on the texture.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetLowerLeftPixel(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the lower left pixel coordinate of the sprite on the texture using individual X and Y values. This is a convenience overload that creates a Vector2 and calls the main SetLowerLeftPixel method.
member.param: The X pixel coordinate on the texture.
The Y pixel coordinate on the texture.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetLowerLeftPixel(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the lower-left corner position of the sprite within the texture in pixel coordinates. Recalculates UV coordinates, applies bleed compensation, and optionally resizes the sprite based on autoResize or pixelPerfect settings.
member.param: The pixel coordinates of the lower-left corner in texture space.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetLowerLeftPixel(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the lower-left corner position of the sprite within the texture using individual x and y pixel coordinates. Wrapper method that creates a Vector2 and calls the main SetLowerLeftPixel method.
member.param: The x pixel coordinate of the lower-left corner.
The y pixel coordinate of the lower-left corner.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetPixelDimensions(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the pixel dimensions of the sprite on the texture and updates UV coordinates accordingly. Converts pixel space to UV space, updates the UV rect size, applies bleed compensation, and optionally recalculates sprite size for auto-resize or pixel-perfect modes. If lockWidthAndHeight is true, also updates the sprite's world size to match pixel dimensions.
member.param: The width and height in pixels on the texture.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetPixelDimensions(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the pixel dimensions of the sprite on the texture using individual width and height values. This is a convenience overload that creates a Vector2 and calls the main SetPixelDimensions method.
member.param: The width in pixels on the texture.
The height in pixels on the texture.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetPixelDimensions(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the pixel dimensions of the sprite region within the texture. Updates UV coordinates to match the new dimensions, applies bleed compensation, and optionally updates the sprite's world size based on lockWidthAndHeight, autoResize, or pixelPerfect settings.
member.param: The width and height in pixels of the sprite region.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetPixelDimensions(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the pixel dimensions of the sprite region within the texture using integer width and height values. Wrapper method that creates a Vector2 and calls the main SetPixelDimensions method.
member.param: The width in pixels of the sprite region.
The height in pixels of the sprite region.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.lowerLeftPixel
